FuncDef:
The e1 set loopback command enables the loopback of an E1 channel.
The undo e1 set loopback command disables the loopback.
By default, the loopback is disabled.
CLIs: e1 <e1-number> set loopback { local | remote } [ autoclear period <hold-time> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of CPOS.
The value ranges from 1 to 63 in integer.

Specifies the loopback interface is automatically cleared.
-

Specifies the loopback holding time after which loopback is automatically cleared.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 43200, in minutes.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-Cpos1/0/0] e1 1 set loopback remote autoclear period 5
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The E1 channel provides a variety of loopback functions for tests on different levels:
In the internal loopback, data at the sending end is looped back to the receiving end.In the external remote loopback, the received data is looped back without passing through the E1 framer and generating the payload.
When a loopback is enabled on an E1 channel, the loopback is valid for the synchronous serial interface formed by the E1 channel.
When the link layer protocol of the synchronous serial interface is PPP, the physical status of the synchronous serial interface is Up; whereas the link layer protocol is Down.When the link layer protocol of the synchronous serial interface is HDLC, the physical status of the synchronous serial interface and the link layer protocol are Up.
To configure the loopback automatic clearance function, run the e1 set loopback command. The command takes effect when loopback has been enabled. After time specified by hold-time expires, the loopback configuration is automatically deleted. hold-time specified in the e1 set loopback command takes effect only once.

Precautions
To enable the local loopback of the E1 channel, the channel must be in the master clock mode.
To enable the remote loopback of the E1 channel, the channel must be in the slave clock mode.
